section.name: Running JMS CTS
section.p: JMS CTS is run via the jmscts.bat script (Windows) or the jmscts.sh script (Unix).
These are located in the $JMSCTS_HOME/bin directory.

section.name: Running compliance tests
section.p: On completion, a coverage report report is written to $JMSCTS_HOME/report/html/coverage.html. This contains tests run, requirements covered, and the number of passes and failures.

section.name: Running stress tests
section.p: On completion, a statistics report report is written to $JMSCTS_HOME/report/statistics.html. This indicates the elapsed time for each test.

section.name: Taking snapshot reports
section.p: The compliance and stress tests take some time to run, so it is often useful to take a "snapshot" while they are running:
This will generate reports as indicated in the previous sections.

section.name: Stopping JMS CTS
section.p: This will perform an orderly shutdown of JMS CTS, and generate reports as indicated in the previous sections.
To abort a test (perhaps because it has hung), replace the stop argument with abort
